intro: Polygala ligustroides var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb with slender, angular stems that often grow in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in spike-like clusters, and its leaves are typically narrow and linear. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes various species with unique floral structures. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in chaparral and desert scrub ecosystems.
